Class Toy

  • java.lang.Object
    • Item
      • Toy

  • public class Toy
extends Item
    Toy class implementation for Virtual Pets
    Author:
    Samuel Pell, Ollie Chick

      • getHappinessIncrease

        public int getHappinessIncrease(java.lang.String species)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the amount happiness increases for the pet using the toy.
        Parameters:
        species - Species of animal using toy
        Returns:
        Happiness increase
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Species not known

      • decrementDurability

        public void decrementDurability(int decrement)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Decrements the objects durability; the new durability must be greater than 0. Durability is counted in number of uses remaining; at 0, the item has no uses left and needs to be removed from the player's toyList.
        Parameters:
        decrement - Amount to decrement durability by (must be larger than 0).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - decrement must be larger than 0
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Item's durability is negative or 0; it needs to be removed from the player's toyList

      • setHappinessIncrease

        public void setHappinessIncrease(java.lang.String[] species,
                                 int[] increase)
        Sets the object's happiness increase on a per species basis.
        Parameters:
        species - Species for which this increase applies
        increase - Happiness increase
